ul.li1: 1And a shoot will come out from the stump of Jesse,
ul.li2: and a branch from its roots will bear fruit.
ul.li1: 2And the spirit of Yahweh shall rest on him—
ul.li2: a spirit of wisdom and understanding,
a spirit of counsel and might,
a spirit of knowledge and the fear of Yahweh.
3And his breathHebrew “smelling,” perhaps metaphorically as “delight” as in Amos 5:14; perhaps this line was accidentally copied twice from the preceding line is in the fear of Yahweh.
ul.li1: And he shall judge not by his eyesight,
ul.li2: and he shall rebuke not by what he hears withLiterally “the rumors of” his ears.
ul.li1: 4But he shall judge the poor with righteousness,
ul.li2: and he shall decide for the needy of the earth with rectitude.
ul.li1: And he shall strike the earth with the rod of his mouth,
ul.li2: and he shall kill the wicked person with the breath of his lips.
ul.li1: 5And righteousness shall be the belt around his waist,
ul.li2: and faithfulness the belt around his loins.
ul.li1: 6And a wolf shall stayLiterally “dwell as an alien” with a lamb,
ul.li2: and a leopard shall lie down with a kid,
ul.li1: and a calf and a lion and a fatling together
ul.li2: as a small boy leadsLiterally “and a small boy leading” them.
ul.li1: 7And a cow and a bear shall graze;
ul.li2: their young shall lie down together.
And a lion shall eat straw like the cattle.
ul.li1: 8And an infantLiterally “one nursing” shall play over a serpent’s hole,
ul.li2: and a toddlerLiterally “one who is weaned” shall put his hand on a viper’s hole.
ul.li1: 9They will not injure and they will not destroy on all of my holy mountain,Literally “mountain of holiness”
ul.li2: for the earth will be full of the knowledge of Yahweh,
ul.li3: as the waters cover the sea.

chapter.p: 10And this shall happen on that day:

ul.li1: the nations shall inquire of the root of Jesse,
which shall be standing as a signal to the peoples,
and his resting place shall be glorious.

chapter.p: 11And this shall happen on that day:

ul.li1: The Lord will again extend his hand a second time
to acquire the remnant of his people that is left,
from Assyria, Egypt, Pathros, Cush, Elam, Shinar, Hamath, and the coastlands of the sea,
12and he will raise a signal for the nations.
And he will gather the outcasts of Israel,
ul.li2: and he will gather the scattered ones of Judah together from the four cornersLiterally “wings” of the earth.
ul.li1: 13And the jealousy of Ephraim shall depart,
ul.li2: and the enemies of Judah shall be cut off.
ul.li1: Ephraim shall not be jealous of Judah,
ul.li2: and Judah shall not be an enemy of Ephraim.
ul.li1: 14But they shall swoopLiterally “fly” upon the Philistine shoulder,That is, the hill country west of Judah westward.Literally “sea”
ul.li2: Together they shall plunder the sons of the east.
ul.li1: Edom and Moab will be under their command,Literally “the stretching of their hand”
ul.li2: and the sons of Ammon will be their subjugated people.
ul.li1: 15And Yahweh will divideOr “utterly destroy” the tongueProbably the “gulf” of the sea of Egypt,That is, the Red Sea
ul.li2: and he will wave his hand over the riverThat is, the Euphrates River with his scorching wind;
ul.li1: and he will strike it into seven streams,
ul.li2: and he will make it passable by foot.Literally “cause to walk with the sandal”
ul.li1: 16So there shall be a highway from Assyria for the remnant of his people that remains,
ul.li2: as there was for Israel whenLiterally “in the day” it went up from the land of Egypt.
